// Source: configWithPublicNewFunc{}
//
// Generated by this command:
//
//	go-options -public=true -namespace=PublicFuncOptionNs -option=PublicFuncOption configWithPublicNewFunc
//

package test

import "fmt"

import "github.com/google/go-cmp/cmp"

type ApplyPublicFuncOptionFunc func(c *configWithPublicNewFunc) error

func (f ApplyPublicFuncOptionFunc) apply(c *configWithPublicNewFunc) error {
	return f(c)
}

func NewConfigWithPublicNewFunc(options ...PublicFuncOption) (configWithPublicNewFunc, error) {
	var c configWithPublicNewFunc
	err := applyConfigWithPublicNewFuncOptions(&c, options...)
	return c, err
}

func applyConfigWithPublicNewFuncOptions(c *configWithPublicNewFunc, options ...PublicFuncOption) error {
	for _, o := range options {
		if err := o.apply(c); err != nil {
			return err
		}
	}
	return nil
}

type PublicFuncOption interface {
	apply(*configWithPublicNewFunc) error
}

type publicFuncOptionNamespace struct{}

var PublicFuncOptionNs publicFuncOptionNamespace

type publicFuncOptionMyIntImpl struct {
	o int
}

func (o publicFuncOptionMyIntImpl) apply(c *configWithPublicNewFunc) error {
	c.myInt = o.o
	return nil
}

func (o publicFuncOptionMyIntImpl) Equal(v publicFuncOptionMyIntImpl) bool {
	switch {
	case !cmp.Equal(o.o, v.o):
		return false
	}
	return true
}

func (o publicFuncOptionMyIntImpl) String() string {
	name := "MyInt"

	// hack to avoid go vet error about passing a function to Sprintf
	var value interface{} = o.o
	return fmt.Sprintf("%s: %+v", name, value)
}

func (publicFuncOptionNamespace) MyInt(o int) PublicFuncOption {
	return publicFuncOptionMyIntImpl{
		o: o,
	}
}
